title: Low Risk
Meaning: You are at a low risk of experiencing opioid substance abuse.
Based on hundreds of reports of various opioid substance abuse cases, you have a low potential risk in comparison.
You should prepare to prevent opioid abuse by limiting your use and using helpful resources
Prevention: To prevent opioid substance abuse, use these resources and take these steps:
- Consistently take Fentanyl Test Strips to make sure the substance consumption is not at overdose
- Read Opioid Overdose Training and Witness Steps
- Be familiar with Naloxone centers near you to help those in need

title: Moderate Risk
Meaning: You are at a moderate risk of experiencing opioid substance abuse.
Based on hundreds of reports of various opioid substance abuse cases, you have a potential risk in comparison.
You should be familiar with Naloxone resources and centers in case of an overdose
Prevention: To prevent opioid substance abuse, use these resources and take these steps:
- Consistently take Fentanyl Test Strips to make sure the substance consumption is not at overdose
- Read Opioid Overdose Training and Witness Steps
- Be familiar with Naloxone centers near you to help those in need
- Manage chronic pain and mental health

Resources.name: Local Health Centers for substance abuse services

title: High Risk
Meaning: You are at a high risk of experiencing opioid substance abuse.
Based on hundreds of reports of various opioid substance abuse cases, you have a high potential risk in comparison.
You should be familiar with Naloxone resources and centers in case of an overdose
It is recommended to visit a rehabilitation center early to make sure you are safe.
Prevention: To prevent opioid substance abuse, use these resources and take these steps:
- Be familiar with Naloxone centers near you to help those in need
- Manage chronic pain and mental health
- Visiting a local rehabilitation center or local Naloxone center
- Calling a Substance Abuse Prevention Regional Coalition Agency

Resources.name: NJ Substance Abuse Prevention Regional Coalition Agency

title: Very High Risk
Meaning: You are at a very high risk of experiencing opioid substance abuse.
Based on hundreds of reports of various opioid substance abuse cases, you have a very high potential risk in comparison.
You should be familiar with Naloxone resources and centers in case of an overdose
It is recommended to visit a rehabilitation center early to make sure you are safe.
Prevention: To prevent opioid substance abuse, use these resources and take these steps:
- Be familiar with Naloxone centers near you to help those in need
- Manage chronic pain and mental health
- Visiting a local rehabilitation center or local Naloxone center
- Calling a Substance Abuse Prevention Regional Coalition Agency
- Call the SAMHSA National Helpline: 1-800-662-4357

Resources.name: NJ Substance Abuse Prevention Regional Coalition Agency
